conclusion: Use the concept of inverse proportionality and given velocity values at points A and B.
Identify the relationship between velocity and displacement: velocity is inversely proportional to displacement.
Use the given velocities at points A and B: v_A = 4 m/s, v_B = 2 m/s.
Set up the proportion using inverse proportionality: 4 = 1/x_A and 2 = 1/x_B.
Substitute x_B = 2 into the equation for v_B: 2 = 1/2.
Calculate the time t it takes for the detector to move from point A to point B: t = x_B/v_B = 2/2 = 1 second.
Since the time t is the same for both points A and B, the time taken to move from A to B is 1 second.
